page.title: 10TRANSPORT IN BURNHAM MARKET
page.content: The Eastern Counties bus company, part of the National Bus Company, has withdrawn village services in the past few years: its only remaining service through our area is the "Coastliner" service which runs from King's Lynn to Lowestoft in the summer months. Burnham Market now relies on independent bus companies which operate services to Wells, Hunstanton, Fakenham and King's Lynn. The community mini-bus service takes pensioners to Wells twice per month and Age Concern operates a service to Fakenham weekly. Many people have their own cars and there is a garage/ filling station in the survey area which also retails and services vehicles. The railway line to Burnham Market was closed in the early 1960's and now the nearest railway station is at King's Lynn.
